column1: John Sumter Bull (September 25, 1934 August 11, 2008) was a U.S. Navy test pilot, aeronautical engineer, and a NASA astronaut.
Bull attended primary and secondary schools in Memphis, Tennessee, and graduated in 1952 from Central High School.
He received a bachelor of science degree in Mechanical Engineering from Rice University in 1957 before joining the Navy in June of that same year.
Bull was a Navy fighter pilot with the VF-114 squadron aboard the carriers USS Ranger, USS Hancock, and USS Kitty Hawk.
He attended Stanford University graduate school and received a Ph.D. in Aeronautical Engineering in 1973.
From 1986 until his retirement in 1989, he managed NASA-wide research programs in autonomous systems technology for space applications.
He maintained an office at NASA Ames until at least 1997.
Bull died on August 11, 2008 at the age of 73 [1] in South Lake Tahoe, California.
